text: Werner Hans Kramarsky (March 5, 1926 – August 22, 2019) was a Dutch-born American public official and art collector. His collection included works by Mel Bochner, Eva Hesse, Ellsworth Kelly, Sol LeWitt, Brice Marden, Agnes Martin, Richard Serra. He donated some of it to the Museum of Modern Art. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American art collectors Category:American naval personnel of World War II Category:Dutch emigrants to the United States Category:New York City public officials Category:New York University School of Law alumni Category:People from Amsterdam Category:People from Manhattan Category:The New School alumni
title: Werner H. Kramarsky
